161.desc:
Vice-captain of the Shinsengumi, a security organization active around Kyoto during the Bakumatsu period, Hijikata Toshizou.
 Upholding strictly absolute discipline within the squad, he is a feared demon of a vice-captain even amongst the peerless swordsmen that are his squad-mates.
 In battle, he rages wildly like a devil yet retains his rational aspect as a tactician, a rare type of Berserker.
 The demonic vice-captain bearing the brand of loyalty ---Shinsengumi, advance!

162.name: Chacha
162.desc:
Niece of Oda Nobunaga, the Conqueror of the Warring States, and concubine of Toyotomi Hideyoshi. Also known as the Child of the Sun. Happy-go-lucky and insolent and a super wastrel with luxurious tastes, at any rate she is a troublesome and expensive woman.
 Even though her stubborness can make the Tenkabito (Toyotomi Hideyoshi) clutch his head, for some reason she is a beloved playful-type princess that cannot be hated.
 "So quickly bring me what I want!".
 A happy-go-lucky and dramatic, gorgeous and luxurious violent beauty!

She is considered to have immersed herself on mysticism out of belief in the existence of the Lemurian continent, eventually coming in contact with a higher existence ｢Mahatma｣ and its collective body ｢Hierarchy｣, acquiring many wisdoms in the process. 149.desc:
One of the genesis deities from Mesopotamian Mythology. The gods were produced by the fresh water that is Abzû, and the salt water that is Tiamat. Afterwards, those children gods rose in revolt against the primordial father Abzû and obtained supremacy over the world. At that time, Tiamat gently approved of her children’s actions. An evidence that the love for her children won over the love for her husband.

  However, the gods pointed their blades even to their mother Tiamat. Tiamat grieved, went mad and gave birth to 11 magical beasts as her new children to confront the gods. At the end of the struggle, Tiamat and her 11 magical beasts were defeated It has been said that the gods teared her corpse in two, creating heavens and earth, thus establishing the ceremony of genesis of the human world.

 To begin with, the 72 demons were “a system to efficiently promote proper reason” invented by the founder of (human) magic, Solomon. Said system grieved and raged against the relationship between King Solomon and humans, becoming a curse that takes action to conquer “the imperfectness of humans” that King Solomon continued to ignore.
